subject: Productivity
title: The Strategy of Saying No
description: Learn The Strategy of Saying No in one minute.

hook.text: When Steve Jobs returned to Apple in 1997, he cut 70% of product lines. Focus saved the company.

buildup.text: Jobs said: People think focus means saying yes. It means saying no to the hundred other good ideas.

discovery.text: Apple went from 350 products to 10. Each got more resources, better design, and stronger market position.

twist.text: Saying no is harder than saying yes. Every cut kills someone's project and creates internal resistance.

climax.text: Strategic excellence is defined by what you refuse, not what you attempt. Discipline of no is rare and powerful.

punchline.text: Strategy is choosing what not to do.

quiz.question: What did Steve Jobs do to save Apple when he returned?
options: Cut 70% of product lines to focus on the best
